summary: This document is a search and seizure warrant issued for the premises located at 9 East 71st Street, New York, New York, believed to be owned by Jeffrey Epstein. The warrant is related to violations of sex trafficking laws and authorizes the seizure of evidence related to the abuse of minor girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the target subject of the investigation, accused of sexually abusing and trafficking minor girls.

persons.name: Leslie Adamczyk
persons.context: Leslie Adamczyk is the federal law enforcement officer who applied for the search warrant.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: Barbara Moses is the judge who signed the search warrant.

persons.name: Victim-1
persons.context: Victim-1 is identified as a victim who was sexually abused by Epstein and has provided information to law enforcement.

connections.description: Jeffrey Epstein is accused of sexually abusing Victim-1 on multiple occasions.
Leslie Adamczyk applied for the search warrant which was signed by Barbara Moses.

events.title: Sexual Abuse of Victim-1
events.description: Victim-1 was sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein on multiple occasions between 2002 and 2005.

events.title: Search Warrant Issued
events.description: A search warrant was issued for Epstein's residence to gather evidence related to sex trafficking.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: The search warrant is related to violations of Title 18, United States Code, Sections 371 and 1591, concerning sex trafficking of minors.
The premises to be searched is a multi-story residence owned by Jeffrey Epstein.
Victim-1 has provided corroborated information regarding the abuse she suffered at Epstein's residence.
